title: Branch-Commit-Validate: A Git-Inspired Workflow for Autonomous Red-Team Agents
authors: C. Shringi*, A. Hillel-Tuch, S. Rizwan* (*Student Researchers)
venue: World Congress in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, & Applied Computing (CSCE) 路 2025
abstract: Novel workflow framework for autonomous red-team agents inspired by Git version control, enabling structured offensive security testing and validation processes. Research collaboration with student researchers advancing autonomous security testing methodologies.

title: Physical Memory Attacks and a Memory Safe Management System for Memory Defense
venue: Springer Transactions on Computational Science & Computational Intelligence 路 March 2024 (Extended from CSCE 2022)
abstract: Extended journal version presenting novel physical memory attack vectors and proposing a memory-safe management system designed to defend against both traditional and emerging memory-based attacks in modern computing systems. Includes open-source proof-of-concept implementation released for research and industry adoption.

title: Technical Book Reviewer: Security-Driven Software Development
authors: Author: Aspen Olmsted 路 Reviewer: Alon Hillel-Tuch
abstract: Technical book reviewer for "Security-Driven Software Development: Learn to analyze and mitigate risks in your software projects." Provided expert review on security practices, threat modeling, and secure development methodologies for comprehensive software security guide.

title: Priority Based Soft-Solution for Operating System Integrity Due To Randomized Hardware Faults At The Transistor Level
abstract: Proposes a priority-based software solution to maintain operating system integrity when facing randomized hardware faults at the transistor level, addressing critical reliability challenges in modern computing systems.

title: Data Siphoning Through Advanced Persistent Transmission Attacks At The Physical Layer
abstract: This paper explores data exfiltration dynamics across complex networked systems, examining how sophisticated attackers establish persistent transmission flows at the physical layer that evade traditional network security detection mechanisms. Focus on nation-state level threats and defense strategies.
impact: Impact: 480+ downloads 路 1,300+ abstract views on SSRN 路 Multiple citations

title: Implementation of Crowdfunding in the United States: Regulatory and Market Challenges
abstract: Analysis of crowdfunding platform implementation challenges following the JOBS Act passage, examining regulatory compliance frameworks, market structure evolution, and investor protection mechanisms in emerging equity crowdfunding markets.

title: Crowdfunding Platform Architecture and Regulatory Frameworks
abstract: Explores technical and regulatory architectures for crowdfunding platforms, proposing frameworks for balancing innovation, market efficiency, and compliance with emerging securities regulations under the JOBS Act.

title: Developing Focal Point Networks for State-Centered Genocide Prevention
abstract: Examines the development of focal point networks as mechanisms for state-centered genocide prevention, exploring coordination strategies and institutional frameworks for early intervention.
